abcde.title: Asymmetry
abcde.description: One half of the lesion does not match the other half in shape or internal structure.

abcde.title: Border
abcde.description: Borders may appear irregular, notched, or blurred rather than smooth and even.

abcde.title: Color
abcde.description: Multiple colors or uneven color distribution in one lesion can be concerning.

abcde.title: Diameter
abcde.description: Larger size can matter, but small lesions can also be clinically important.

abcde.title: Evolution
abcde.description: Any change over time in size, shape, color, or symptoms is a key warning sign.

dermoscopyBasics.title: What Dermoscopy Adds
dermoscopyBasics.body: Dermoscopy uses magnification and controlled light to reveal subsurface patterns that are often invisible to the naked eye.

dermoscopyBasics.title: Polarized vs Non-Polarized
dermoscopyBasics.body: Different dermoscopy modes emphasize different structures; using consistent capture improves interpretability and model stability.

dermoscopyBasics.title: Why Standardization Matters
dermoscopyBasics.body: Consistent framing, focus, and lighting reduce input variability and help both clinicians and AI models evaluate lesions more reliably.

lesions.title: Melanoma
lesions.overview: Melanoma is an aggressive skin cancer arising from melanocytes and requires urgent professional evaluation.
lesions.prevalenceNote: Minority class in HAM10000 compared with nevi.
keyVisualFeatures: Asymmetry in shape or internal structure
Variegated color with dark and light components

demographics.sexTendency: No consistent strong bias across populations

lesions.title: Melanocytic Nevus
lesions.overview: Melanocytic nevi are common benign pigmented lesions and represent the majority class in many dermoscopy datasets.
lesions.prevalenceNote: Largest class in HAM10000, strongly contributing to class imbalance.

lesions.title: Basal Cell Carcinoma
lesions.overview: Basal cell carcinoma is a common non-melanoma skin cancer that usually grows slowly but still requires treatment.
lesions.prevalenceNote: Moderate representation in HAM10000 relative to nevus.

demographics.sexTendency: Slight male predominance in some cohorts

lesions.title: Actinic Keratosis / Intraepithelial Carcinoma
lesions.overview: Actinic keratoses and related intraepithelial lesions occur on chronically sun-damaged skin and may progress without treatment.
lesions.prevalenceNote: Smaller class with clinically important risk context.
dermoscopicClues: Follicular openings with perifollicular white halos

lesions.title: Benign Keratosis
lesions.overview: Benign keratosis lesions include seborrheic keratosis-like appearances and are non-cancerous.

lesions.title: Dermatofibroma
lesions.overview: Dermatofibromas are benign fibrohistiocytic lesions that are often firm and stable over time.

demographics.sexTendency: Reported more often in females in some cohorts

lesions.title: Vascular Lesion
lesions.overview: Vascular lesions in this dataset are generally benign blood-vessel related lesions such as angioma-like patterns.
